author: anon.
contents: list of words - including proper names - all of which occur in the Old and New Testaments, with the exception of one. the items are arranged alphabetically, occupying different columns according to their initial letter, which is the only one taken into account for the purposes of the alphabetical order: col. i presumably contained words beginning with k; col. ii contains words in l; and col. iii, words in m.
propernames:
col. ii:
Loukas; Lustros [Lustra]; Laban.
col. iii:
Melchesedek [Melchisedek]; Matthat.
size: of the sides of the ostracon's triangular shape: 14.5 x 12.5 x 9
statepreservation: fragment of ostracon of triangular shape (14.5 x 12.5 x 9 cm), containing the remains of three columns of writing; col. i has preserved the ends of 4 lines; col. ii presents 8 lines, and from col. iii only three lines survive.
lectionalsigns: no iota adscript; correction by writing over the - wrongly - started letter; syllables are separated by blank spaces in some words. (probable) itacistic mistake: ? for ? or ??.
